intro: Goodenia wilunensis, commonly known as the Wiluna goodenia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Goodeniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, while its flowers range in color from white to pink or red. Goodenia wilunensis is often found in open woodlands and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
